Welcome to the project demo site. We will walk through a few hypothetical examples involving 3 drivers: Alice, Bob, and Eve, who work with a platform called Solidrive.

Solidrive is a new kind of platform for gig drivers, that focuses on a privacy-first approach in its business.

Step through the workflow below by following the instructions and clicking 'Next' after each step to see how it works.

A completely new user would begin by signing up for a data pod. For brevity of the demo, Alice, Bob, and Eve already have pre-registered pods at ...provided by the JavaScript code..., although these could be anywhere they like.

Choose a character and note down their login details. Then, use these details to login to their pod provider and gain access to their personal pod.


Output:

Sign up for Solidrive (we'll skip the ID and other checks and formal employment processes for this demo). To complete sign up, Solidrive ask that you give them append-only access to a collection in your pod, so that they can add records as you work.

Default permissions depend on the pod provider. In this demo case (with default Community Solid Server configuration), the default permissions allow anyone to read new resources or write to them.

Let's create a new container in the pod where Solidrive data will be stored, remove all access to this container for the public, and grant append-only access to the Solidrive company.
